abstract: Visitors who reach a retail site through sponsored links are more likely to buy than those who click on organic search results.
snippet: Visitors who reach a retail site through sponsored links are more likely to buy than those who click on organic search results.
lead_paragraph: Marketers of retail Web sites face a basic choice: is it better to spend lots of money on ads that show up alongside results on search engines like Google? Or should marketing dollars be spent making a site more likely to show up in the true (or “organic”) results of the search?

headline.main: The Payoff of Ads on Search Engines
headline.print_headline: The Payoff of Ads on Search Engines
